DataElement.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Performed Study Activity Reason Code ISO21090.DSET.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A characteristic or requirement that disqualifies a subject from participation in a study. EXAMPLE(S): pregnancy A coded value specifying the motivation, cause, or rationale of an activity. EXAMPLE(S): routine requirement, drug reaction, infectious disease reporting requirement, on patient request.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Performed Study Activity Reason Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A collection containing unordered distinct/discrete values of the type CD.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
